doc.name: byte
doc.summary: Designates a single byte as part of a chunk expression.

examples.example: put byte 12 to 14 of it into tAnswer

example.p: get the first byte to tString

examples.example: repeat for each byte tByte of tString

description.overview: Use the byte keyword to refer to a specific byte or bytes in a container.
description.comments:
A byte is an 8-bit unit and can only be reliably used with binary data.
The hierarchy of the new and altered chunk types is as follows:
byte w of codeunit x of codepoint y of char z of word ...
In versions prior to 7.0 the byte chunk was identical in functionality to the character chunk. For backwards compatibility the byte chunk returns the corresponding native character from Unicode text, or a "?" if nor reperesentable, but this behavior is deprecated and should not be used in new code.
